- "Toggle maximized panel" to maximize the panel

data.title: Network: Folders unable to be opened

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-09T00:26:45.394Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0|
|htmltagwrap|bradgashler|0.0.3|
|vscode-great-icons|emmanuelbeziat|1.1.44|
|php-debug|felixfbecker|1.10.0|
|auto-close-tag|formulahendry|0.3.9|
|auto-complete-tag|formulahendry|0.0.1|
|auto-rename-tag|formulahendry|0.0.11|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.5.3|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.2.0|
|html-css-class-completion|Zignd|1.0.3|

---
If I try to open a folder either from the explorer tab or file menu, the folder isn't opened. I get the file dialog where I can choose my folder. After choosing the folder I want, the VS Code window flashes, reloads and my folder is not added to the file explorer. I tried creating a test folder on my desktop and got the same results.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In VS Code Explorer tab click 'open folder' or go to file>open folder...
2. Browse for and select a folder.
3. Click select folder button.

data.title: Add workbench.action.focusActiveEditorGroup to commandsToSkipShell
data.body:
This change adds the `workbench.action.focusActiveEditorGroup` command to
the default value array of the `terminal.integrated.commandsToSkipShell`
setting so that it is available for key bindings when the user is inside
of the integrated terminal.

Resolves #21393.

/cc @Tyriar

data.title: Add workbench.action.focusActiveEditorGroup to default value of terminal.integrated.commandsToSkipShell setting
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

To make it easy for the user to jump back to the active editor from any focused UI element, they can create a keybinding to the `workbench.action.focusActiveEditorGroup` command.  However, this key binding will not work when focus is in the terminal UI unless they add this command to the `terminal.integrated.commandsToSkipShell` setting, which requires copy/pasting the default value of this setting and then adding the desired command to that list.

It'd be ideal if `workbench.action.focusActiveEditorGroup` was added to that setting's default list of commands so that this type of binding will be available from within the integrated terminal UI.

I've got a PR prepared, will be sending it shortly.

data.title: Go to file -> crtl+n -> open right not working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-08T23:31:51.320Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-markdownlint|DavidAnson|0.6.2|
|beautify|HookyQR|0.8.8|
|alignment|annsk|0.3.0|
|npm-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.3.0|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.2.0|
|prettier-vscode|esbenp|0.9.0|
|git-project-manager|felipecaputo|1.0.1|
|auto-close-tag|formulahendry|0.3.9|
|auto-rename-tag|formulahendry|0.0.11|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.5.3|
|vscode-react-native|vsmobile|0.3.1|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

Can't open a file in a new panel using the following key combo

1. cmd+p
2. Search for something that produces at least 2 results
2. crtl+n 
3. cmd+enter
4. Nothing happens. I expect file to open in a new panel on the right.

But if I use down arrow for step 3 instead of crtl+n everything works as expected. Thanks for adding crtl+n to the quick open! It was killing me that it wasn't there before ;)

data.title: Launch.json autocomplete doesn't add the default value
data.body:
- Go to a node2 launch config
- Type `sma`
- See `smartStep` suggestion, hit enter to accept it
- It completes with only `"smartStep"`, but it should complete with `"smartStep": true`

data.title: [Debugger] VS Code no longer rebinds breakpoints on save file
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:
```
Version 1.10.0-insider
Commit 25c55638340197fc9c8767aba9d32a0c29ccf68a
Date 2017-02-21T07:10:22.174Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0
```
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Begin debugging (I am using the C# debugger against a .NET Core application)
2. Stop at a breakpoint
3. While stopped, alter the file (such as add a line break) and save the file

Expected: In the past, Code would send SetBreakpoints command when the file was saved.

Actual: Code no longer sends SetBreakpoints on file saved.

The C# debugger supports matching source to the debugged binary exactly using checksums. If the file on disk is saved we expect to rebind breakpoints so that we can send failure messages. This used to be the behavior in code but in no longer does this.

data.title: VS Code git issues
data.body:
I am working a large directory and opened vscode in the root folder.

However, in the git area I am only shown the changed files of that very directory rather than those of subdirectories as well.

How can i change that?

data.title: Feature Request: Allow to specify languages in `formatOnSave`
data.body:
Created because of [issue in my extension](https://github.com/editor-rs/vscode-rust/pull/74).

Some people needs to be able to specify what languages should be formatted automatically.
It seems right for me.
I suggest to extend `editor.formatOnSave` to be either `Boolean` or `Object` where fields' names are language ids and fields' values are `Boolean` which indicates whether the language should be formatted on save.

It is backward-compatible change.

Before:

```json
"editor.formatOnSave": true
```

After:

```json
"editor.formatOnSave": {
    "rust": true,
    "javascript": false
}
```

data.title: Simplify filing a bug report for an extension

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
If there is a "bugs" URL in the extension's package.json, we could:
- Show a link at the top of the extension editor (the one opening when I click on an extension in the extensions viewlet).
- Either let the Report Issues action ask if it's for one of the installed extensions
- Or have a separate action for extensions, e.g., Help > Report Extension Issues, that asks for which of the installed extensions.

data.title: Extensions: update patch doesn't show immediatly for locally installed extension
data.body:
Verifying #17290

- download https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-eslint/files/630866/vscode-eslint-1.2.0.zip and rename to `vscode-eslint-1.2.0.vsix`
- run `code-insiders --install-extension ./vscode-eslint-1.2.0.vsix`
- run vscode-insiders. The extensions view shows in the extensions viewlet, but with the old version
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/23310270/4a98f690-fab2-11e6-90dd-e805db5544e3.png)
- enter 'eslint' in the filter box. Now the update button appears
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/23310318/74c813f6-fab2-11e6-856d-ee19d9127363.png)

data.title: Add ability to trap `right-arrow` key press on a Quickpick item
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: `1.10.0-insider` 256d76fed7947e7289f921df10658d7a69233b65
- OS Version: macOS Sierra `10.12.3 (16D32)`

I would like to be able to trap a `right-arrow` key press on a Quickpick item, to provide similar behavior to the built-in open files picker.

data.title: Add ability to update a Quickpick placeholder text dynamically
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: `1.10.0-insider` 256d76fed7947e7289f921df10658d7a69233b65
- OS Version: macOS Sierra `10.12.3 (16D32)`

I would love to be able to change the placeholder text after `showQuickPick` has been called. That way I could have the quickpick say something like `Searching for blah...` while the promise is still waiting, and then switch to different text once its resolved.

Currently I am mimicking this behavior by showing 1 quickpick with the `Searching for ...` text, and then when the promise resolves I am cancelling that quickpick and show a new one -- but if there was text typed during that time it would be lost.

data.title: Add ability to stream or push items into a Quickpick
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: `1.10.0-insider` 256d76fed7947e7289f921df10658d7a69233b65
- OS Version: macOS Sierra `10.12.3 (16D32)`

Basically provide a way to add additional items to a quickpick after it is shown and/or provide a way to pass an array of promises to `showQuickPick` that would add items as each one resolves.

data.title: Universal Format Selection As Language
data.body:
I have several scenarios where I have multiple language types in a single file such as plain text or markdown where I would like to format just a selected code block. For example, I might be in markdown and want to just change the code block section using the json or xml formatter. Today, I have to change the entire language to that language of json or xml, use the format select and switch it back to markdown. I would love to be able to tell it to format selection as a specific language format.

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a markdown file.
2. Create a code section using 
```
{"languages":["javascript","java", "sql", "xml"]}
```
3. Select the line just containing the json code and try to format it.
